intro: Cyphostemma robsonii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits that are typically green when mature. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various environments, though it thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in woodlands and along riverbanks, where it can climb trees or shrubs.
